original: LEWIN, Johan Algot, Direktör, Umeå, f Ballo, Jkps l, 26/9 84 av Johan Oskar Johansson o Augusta Nilsson, gm Ruth Olofsson. Fackkurser Hermods. Anst AB Ideström & Co Oskarsh 04—10, prakt Hamburg 11, ag.-aff Malmö 12, kont.ch h Axel Erikson & Co V.ås 13—14, dir Västerb imp.AB Umeå 15—20, etabl fma AB Algot Lewin 20. Fd led stdflm, dräts.kamm o el.styr; ordf hamndir, led kyrkoflm, kyrkoråd. Styr.led Västerb stadshyp.frn, miss.församl, ungd.frn, soldathemmet. Resor: Ital, Schweiz mfl länd 32, Frankr mfl länd 38. Frimurare.
translated: LEWIN, Johan Algot, Director, Umeå, born in Ballo, Jämtland county, on September 26, 1884 to Johan Oskar Johansson and Augusta Nilsson. Married to Ruth Olofsson. Completed vocational courses at Hermods. Employment history: worked at AB Ideström & Co in Oskarshamn from 1904 to 1910, practical training in Hamburg in 1911, agricultural and trade affairs in Malmö in 1912, clerk at Axel Erikson & Co in Västerås from 1913 to 1914, director at Västerbotten Import AB in Umeå from 1915 to 1920, established AB Algot Lewin in 1920. Former board member of the State Railway, treasurer's office, and electricity board; chairman of the harbor board, member of the church board. Board member of Västerbotten's municipal mortgage institution, missionary parish, youth organization, and the soldier's home. Traveled to Italy, Switzerland, and other countries in 1932, and France and other countries in 1938. Freemason.

structured.name: Johan Algot Lewin
structured.description: Johan Algot Lewin was a Swedish director born on September 26, 1884, in Ballo, Jämtland County. He was married to Ruth Olofsson. He completed vocational courses at Hermods and held various positions throughout his career, including working at AB Ideström & Co in Oskarshamn from 1904 to 1910, Axel Erikson & Co in Västerås from 1913 to 1914, and serving as the director of Västerbotten Import AB in Umeå from 1915 to 1920. In 1920, he established his own company, AB Algot Lewin. Johan Algot Lewin was also involved in several boards and organizations such as the State Railway, Treasurer's Office, Electricity Board, Harbor Board, Church Board, Västerbotten's Municipal Mortgage Institution, Missionary Parish, Youth Organization, and Soldier's Home. He had a passion for traveling and visited various countries including Italy, Switzerland, France, and more. Johan Algot Lewin was also a member of the Freemasons.
